intro: Carlina frigida subsp. frigida, commonly known as the alpine cudweed, is a perennial flowering plant native to the alpine regions of Europe and northern Asia. It is characterized by its basal rosette of silver-gray, woolly leaves and produces tall, branched stems with small, blue to purple flowers. The plant thrives in cold, dry environments and is adapted to high-altitude conditions. It has a fibrous root system and is often found in rocky or gravelly soils. Its flowers bloom in late summer, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
